page.title: 05LANDSCAPE
page.content: The{River Thames}meanders through the area as it has through history. It sweeps along the base of{Winter Hill past{Cock Marsh}to where it bends in a muddle of islands by the village before gliding away to{Maidenhead under the{'hanging woods'}of{Cliveden. the{Roman 'Camlet Way'}and the{Saxon {'Wool Way'}linking{London}with the West crossed the river at{Cookham. Although the{Rise}was the site of the earliest settlement as the need to defend the crossing increased in the {Middle Ages}so the village grew around the river.In the nineteenth century the river was the scene of fashionable regattas an swimming galas. More recently ther have been serious floods noteably in 1820 when the six bridges on the{Moor}were washed away, and in 1894 when the{Causeway}was submerged and villagers punted up the High St.
